vehicles.description: A black SUV parked at the end of the row on the right side, positioned closer to the driving lane
vehicles.explanation: The position of the SUV may limit visibility for the ego car and requires extra caution in case the SUV initiates a maneuver.

vehicles.description: A red car in the foreground on the right, positioned at an angle suggesting it may be pulling into or out of parking
vehicles.explanation: The orientation and position of the red car could indicate an imminent movement that requires the ego car to be prepared to stop or yield.

vehicles.description: Parked cars on both sides of the street, various makes and colors, mostly facing the same direction as the ego car.
vehicles.explanation: These parked cars narrow the usable road width, requiring careful navigation and reduced speed.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A motorcycle parked at the edge of the road on the far right.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The motorcycle could decide to merge into traffic, requiring the ego vehicle to adjust speed or position.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Pedestrians visible on the sidewalk to the right, one is close to a pedestrian crossing.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The presence of a pedestrian in the crosswalk demands that the ego car slows down or stops to give the right of way.

traffic signs.description: Pedestrian crossing marked on the road, with road signs indicating its presence.
traffic signs.explanation: The marked pedestrian crossing alerts the ego car to be ready to yield to pedestrians.

suggestions: Proceed with caution, maintain a reduced speed to respond to the possible actions of the parked vehicles, especially the red car, and be prepared to stop for the crossing pedestrian. Keep a safe distance from parked vehicles to allow maneuvering room in case a vehicle pulls out unexpectedly or pedestrians enter the roadway from between parked cars. Ensure the right of way is given to the pedestrian on the crosswalk.
